newsitem.title: UK: Copper remains under $2,600 in late LME trading.
newsitem.headline: Copper remains under $2,600 in late LME trading.

text.p: Copper prices remained under the $2,600 level during Wednesday evening LME inter-office trading, having encountered tough resistance earlier in the session.
Traders said the market will continue to stall below the expected band of resistance around $2,610 and above, unless there is a sharp pick-up in interest or significant inventory falls.
Current daily stock movements on the LME are low-key, either a small drawdown or a modest increase.
At 1800 gmt three months copper was quoted at $2,588/90 a tonne, little changed from the kerb.
Aluminium, which was checked earlier at $1,600, was indicated at $1,594/96, also close to kerb levels.
